title: Crispy Tofu Banh Mi
shortDescription: Indulge in the perfect combination of crispy tofu, pickled vegetables, and flavorful condiments with this delicious banh mi sandwich.
fullDescription: Indulge in the perfect combination of crispy tofu, pickled vegetables, and flavorful condiments with this delicious banh mi sandwich. A fusion of Vietnamese and international flavors.

instructionGroups.label: For the crispy tofu
instructions: In a bowl, whisk together soy sauce and rice vinegar.
Add the tofu slices to the bowl and marinate for 15 minutes.
Remove the tofu from the marinade and coat each slice with cornstarch.
Heat vegetable oil in a skillet over medium heat.
Add the tofu slices to the skillet and cook until crispy and golden brown on both sides.
Transfer the tofu to a paper towel-lined plate to drain excess oil.

instructionGroups.label: For the pickled vegetables
instructions: In a small bowl, combine rice vinegar, sugar, and salt. Stir until the sugar and salt dissolve.
Add the julienned carrot and daikon radish to the bowl and toss to coat the vegetables in the pickling liquid.
Let the vegetables sit for at least 30 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Drain the pickled vegetables before assembling the banh mi sandwiches.

instructionGroups.label: Assembling the banh mi
instructions: Slice a baguette lengthwise, leaving one side intact.
Spread a layer of mayonnaise on the inside of the baguette.
Arrange the crispy tofu slices on one side of the baguette.
Top the tofu with the pickled vegetables.
Add fresh cilantro leaves and sliced jalapenos for extra flavor and heat.
Close the baguette and press it lightly to compress the ingredients.
Slice the banh mi into individual servings and serve immediately.

tips: For extra flavor, marinate the tofu slices overnight in the soy sauce and rice vinegar mixture.
Feel free to add other condiments like sriracha, hoisin sauce, or soy sauce to customize the banh mi to your taste.
Toasted baguette adds a nice crunch to the sandwich. You can lightly toast it before assembling the banh mi.
Serve the banh mi with a side of Vietnamese-style pickled vegetables or a refreshing cucumber salad.
